review_blob: Woody caramel aroma with toffee and esters. Pours a clear golden color with foamy white thick head. Sugary sweet flavor with slight spicy hop flavor. Fairly dry finish and moderate carbonic bite. an interesting hybrid beer with both Belgian and noble hop flavors present.
beer_name: Lagunitas A Little Sumpin Wild Ale

review_blob: Anchor liberty.  Slightly spicy woody notes on the nose.  Pours a medium straw color; brilliantly clear with thick white head. Citrus flavor and slight trace of alcohol. Dry crisp finish. Not much malt. Fairly light bodied with effervescent carb. Good pale that is fairly bitter but quenching.

A creamy syrupy vanilla nose that is perfume like. An inky black pour underneath a creamy taupe head that mimics nitro. Chocolate chewiness that is barely bitter. Very smooth. Luxiorious velvety texture and medium carbonation.  A very complex and wonderful stout that perfectly blends chocolate and vanilla. Masterful.

A chewy plum aroma with roasted nut with alcohol faintly present. A deep brown with garnet highlights and thick taupe head. Chocolate tones with slight back sweetness that finishes dry. Alcohol slickness present and medium bodied. Great barleywine that opens as it warms. Great nutty dark fruit flavor.

beer_name: Dieu du Ciel Corne du Diable
Dieu du Ciel Route des pices

review_blob: A slightly sour floral aroma with Belgian esters that are faint. Slight pepper. A grapefruit color pour with thin white head. Spicy with a slick acidic flavor. Nicely balanced with the thin mouthfeel. Interesting wit that includes a little spice from the flowers.

Peach and apricot aroma that is very complex. A hazy golden pour with slight white foam head. A sweet honey mustiness with a dry finish. Very thin mouthfeel but still chewy. A yeasty flavor lingers.  Very enjoyable and complex strong ale.

A grainy sweet aroma with hints of caramel. Pours a deep golden, almost amber with thick white head. Alcohol and cereal grain present. Very dry finish from both carbonic bite and bitterness. A pretty basic bock that has no flaws.

Sweet toffee and caramel with a nuttiness. Pours a ruby color with foamy off white head. A sweet coconut nuttiness with a caramel finish. Fairly dry finish. Medium bodied with a biting carbonation. Good brown that is very drinkable. Almost candy like.

Spicy, tobacco with hints of cinnamon. Pours an inky black with a taupe head. A tannic, bitter coffee flavor with a crisp finish. Slick, smooth mouthfeel. A complex ale with a citrus twinge. Very pleasant and drinkable.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Chocolate, leather and oak on the nose.  A medium brown with light off white head. A strong alcohol flavor with woody undertones. Medium mouthfeel with effervescent carbonation. Rasiny and oak notes make this an interesting ale once the alcohol tones down. Very smooth.

Sweet toffee notes with faint chocolate traces. Ruby amber color with bubbly off white head. Slight malt flavor but not much else. Finish is very bitter and persists. Very water thin mouthfeel. Does not live up to expectations. Starts nicely but does not deliver.

Nutmeg, cloves and allspice on the nose.  Faint cinnamon.  Deep hue of brown underneath a taupe head.  Allspice starts, but has a tannic, barklike bite that lingers.  Anise noticeable on the finish.  Medium bodied.  There may be a good brown in here somewhere, but its buried underneath the spices.

Strong roasted notes with hints of leather.  Clear garnet bordering on faint brown.  Foamy, white head.  Chocolate and roasted flavors emerge with a hint of wood.  Thin and drinkable, but with an almost tannic, acidic bite on the finish.  Would not guess it was a dubbel.  Smokey and ashy notes drown out the belgian yeast flavors.

Citrus and lemon zest on the nose.  A hazy straw color with bubbly head.  Tangy hop bite, followed by lemon and cearal grain flavor.  Light body that borders on watery.  Low carbonation and thin mouthfeel make it smooth and easy to drink.  Would be refreshing on a hot day.

Slight sweetness from the malt on the aroma.  Garnet, clear with white head.  A malt bomb - lots of bread with faint caramel finish.  Medium body but slick from the alcohol.  A nice bock; sweetness present but balanced well.
Faint sweetness, perhaps a little breadiness.  Clear and copper with light head.  Caramel flavor mixes with biscuit; very clean finish.  Fairly light body.  Slight astringency on the finish.

Esters and belgian funk with a barnyard woodiness.  A transparent copper with diminishing head.  A mild fruitiness that quickly evolves into a dry finish.  A decent amount of carbonation aids the crispness.  A spicy farmhouse ale with slight tartness supplied by the oragnes.  Great twist to the style that works.

Faint trace of spicy hops under a cereal like aroma.  Hazy yellow with a thin white head.  A pilsner and wheat flavor, with no hops and a quick finish.  Lighter mouthfeel with low carbonation.  Ok as a beer, but probably not worth seeking out.

Sweet, sticky malt aroma with bready notes dominating.  Pours a hazy amber/copper with a thin white head.  Flavor is mostly boozy with a slight biscuit backbone.  Medium thick mouthfeel with moderate carbonation.  Good doppelbock.

Funky, cheesy aroma.  A deep amber pour with beige head.  Sweet caramel malt flavor mixes with a biting bitterness but no real hop flavor.  Light - medium bodied.  An interesting IPA but seems average.

Sappy, sticky and resinous spruce and pine needle aromatics. A slightly orange golden pour that is clear and sits underneath a thick, creamy two-finger white head. Pine and northwest hops punch you in the mouth before you expect it. Finish is bitter and bone dry. Caramel traces make a brief appearance but this is about the hops. Very light but not in the least watery. Great ipa. Traces of orange peel as it warms.

Roasted malt with sweetness on the aroma.  Hops are piney but subdued.  Pours a deep mahogeny with thick pillowy taupe head.  Caramel and chocolate start; bitterness arrives late but no real hop flavor to be found.  Thick body that finishes quickly.  Roasted malt and nuttiness make this more like a bitter imperial brown.

Slight lemon spiciness with faint juniper aroma.  Clear golden pour with a faint head.  Slight sourness with lemon like flavors and perhaps citric acid.  Light body that finishes softly.  A good sour that is not too powerful.

A bready, biscuit like aroma with caramelly sweetness.  A deep brown pour with an effervescent white head.  A very bubbly, champage like, ale with caramel and chocolate sweetness.  Medium bodied . Complexity develops as the glass warms.

Chocolate, coffee like roast aroma.  Pours a deep garnet with taupe tight head.  All roasted barley with faint chocolate flavor.  Moderate bitterness.  Medium body with slightly above average carbonation.  A drinkable lager that includes only a little ashiness.

Slight clove ester with banana like sweetness.  Hazy golden with faint head.  Banana and esters seem to dominate but less fruity and slightly boozy flavor.  Thin body and watery.  A beer looking to find itself.
An acidic almost vinegary aroma.  Slighly hazy gold with a thin white head.  Bready and yeasty flavor with smooth bitterness.  Not much depth.  Almost watery.

Spicy juniper appears briefly on the nose, but otherwise a bready aroma.  Clear straw color and low white head.  Fairly muted flavor with graininess reminiscent of a ESB.  Moderate bitterness.  Lower carbonation and light body.  Juniper is only faintly detectable.

Sour and tart on the nose with a hint of raspberry.  Straw colored pour with thin white head.  Soured berry with a hint of bread in the background.  Acerbic finish that is dry.  Thin and light bodied.  Very pleasant.

Pungent piney hop aroma with a tinge of hay.  Clear golden pour with creamy thick white head.  Hops dominate, displaying more bitterness than flavor; a dankness lingers.  Light and crisp.  An interesting IPA but probably not worth having again.

Grapefruit and passion fruit on the nose.  A deep golden color with frothy white head.  Citrus hop flavor suchs the moisture from the mouth and finish is quick and bitter.  Low carbonation and light body make this seem like a cask ale.  Very drinkable and tempered approach to an IPA.

Wheat and malty aromatics; slightly impeded by tart notes.  Clear straw colored with white head.  Blackberry and spring fruit start and the sourness soon dominates.  Slight bodied with faint carbonation.  Enjoyable beer with a hint of fruit flavor.

Cherries on the nose with a sour note.  A mahogeny color with tiny off-white head.  Sourness invades with traces of oak and cherries.  Very thin and delicate on the palate.  Delightful sour that is quite puckering but fruity at the same time.
beer_name: Cascade Drie Zwarte Pieten Sang Noir

review_blob: Scent of candy sweetness with dark fruit in the background.  Hazy, amber pour with pillowy white head.  Chocolate, leather and a touch of smoke make up the flavor; strong bitter finish.  Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.  Pretty good barleywine, but not transcendant.

(09) Candy sweetness on the aroma combined with northwest piney hops.  A hazy caramel color with thick white head.  Caramel toffee sweetness immediately starts and the finish is moderately bitter.  Traces of chocolate appear as the glass warms.  Thick and luxurious body.  Fantastic barelywine that evolves nicely as the beer warms.

(2007) Faint sweet malt aroma; touch of citrus.  A deep copper color with a beige head.  Caramel flavor with slightly sour taste on the finish that is still refreshing.  Syrupy and thick.  Interesting aged beer.  Hops are mostly absent, but retains a bitterness with a lemony-sour flavor.

Faint spicy hop aroma with traces of pine.  Pour is a deep amber with slightly off-white head.  Spruce spiciness mixes with deep caramel malts.  Very strong hop flavor.  Thick, but manageable, body.  A very nice and smooth barelywine; slightly chewy hop flavor, but provides a nice balance to the sweetness.

Slightly sweet, sticky plum aroma.  Pours an amber copper color with very foamy off-white head.  Dark plum and jam-like flavors meld wiht faint spicy hops in the background and an alcoholic warmth on the finish.  Thich, chewy body with a good amount of carbonation.  A fine sipping barleywine that commands respect but finishes clean.

Grainy, slightly sour aroma.  Perhaps a touch of smoke.  A deep mahogeny that borders on black with a pillowy taupe head.  Chocolate flavor with slightly sour flavor that finishes very dry.  Very smooth.  Maybe a bit too thin on body - the substance seems to melt away.

Roasted malt is faint on the aroma.   A very deep hue of brown with garnet edges and a beige head.  Chocolate, leather and alcohol mingle.  Finish has a bitterness that lingers.  Creamy velvety mouthfeel.  A very enjoyable yet drinkable stout that is sessionable and not too bold in any direction.

Burnt malt and bourbon like aroma.  Deep reddish brown opaque color with a creamy taupe head.  Chocolate sweetness starts with traces of smoke and a quick bitterness finishes.  Medium bodied but slick with lower carbonation.  Good stout.  Oatmeal not that noticeable but adds to mouthfeel.

Orange and lemon aroma from the glass.  Hazy dark orange color with tight white head.  Citrus hop flavor to begin with malt present in the background.  Bitterness arrives quickly yet subtely.  Light bodied but not watery.  An enjoyable IPA that is flavorful yet easy enough to drink.

Very faint floral hop aroma.  Clear straw color with faint head.  Bready and grainy flavor that finishes delicately but bitterly.  Light mouthfeel and cask-like carbonation.  A fairly ordinary bitter that is a tad watery.  Flavor is middle of the road.

Sweet and sour grapefruit aroma.  A hazy ruby color with light white head.  A tart flavor of raspberries - malt is faint and hops are absent.  Light, thin bodied and refreshing.  Would be great on a hot day.

Faint chocolate aroma mingles with bourbon notes.  A cola colored pour with an off-white frothy head.  Initial rye taste with bready flavors following.  Little hop flavor other than the bitter finish.  Alcohol warmth and slickness present.  Medium body.  Slightly oaky but a smooth boozy brown ale.
beer_name: Bison Organic Bourbon Barrel Aged Imperial Brown

review_blob: A toasty, caramelly sweetness starts with hints of roast.  Mahogeny pour with ruby edges and thin white head.  A toffee, chocolately flavor that smoothly transitions to a clean finish.  Medium body with moderate carbonation.  Great brown ale with pleasant sweet highlights and crisp bitterness.
UPDATED: MAR 12, 2011
beer_name: Deschutes Red Chair Northwest Pale Ale
